result.execSummary:
The defendant Alan G Kowalefski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Point Firearm At Person, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall not possess any firearms.
Defendant shall have no violent contact with the victim, Georgine. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol; defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.   Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Sheriff's Department for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alan G Kowalefski

records.addlTxt: Sent copy via email of JOC & Complaint to Wis Dept of Justice CIB per request recd 5-1-15
Victim does not request to be present for hearings

Def appeared in person.  Atty Peter John Cannon for State.   Def waives right to attorney.   No contest plea entered.  Court finds def guilty on Ct. 2. Court orders Ct. 1 dismissed & read-in. Statements by Atty. Cannon. Court proceeds to sentencing.
Sent copy via email of Complaint & Bail/Bond to Wis Dept of Justice CIB per request recd 4-16-15
Bond received at Sheriff's Department per Receipt #107845 on 4/9/15; COC Rec#15R 008273 dated 4/15/15
Not have any violent contact with GK; Absolute sobriety; Not possess any dangerous weapons including firearms

Def appeared in person.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Clerk: CP.  Victim present.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Court questions victim. Court sets $650 cash bond, previously posted.  Def waives right to counsel; Court accepts waiver.  Adj to allow pretrial.  Hearing scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 08:15 am.
